column2: Name: “Table 1 of 1 on page 92 of 124”
Table: 84
DESCRIPTION
Construct new Pre-K through 8 school in the Buckroe area of the City.
The combined school is more practical given land restrictions and
would enhance the school's ability to serve more students.
TOTAL: Education
Construct a fifth community center to meet the City's population and
demand requirements in the Buckroe area. The Community Center will
also serve the new school. The aquatics facility would be constructed
in the following year.
Construct pedestrian connection from Pine Chapel bridge over I-64 to
the Power Plant. The project will include a park and trail system
extending from Air Power Park to Coliseum Lake, thus integrating into
the H20, 11 acre and 19 acre projects as an urban promenade. There
will also be development around the lake, from the Aberdeen
neighborhood to the Power Plant boardwalk.
Relocate Bluebird Gap Farm to facilitate the redevelopment of the
current site which is a prime real estate location. Activities include land
acquisition, construction of offices, exhibit housing, development of a
wildlife environment and parking.
Construct a park between City Hall and the Public Safety building to
honor the military branches of service and memorialize military and
public safety servants who died in service. A memorial will also be
erected for 9/11 victims. The Park will have public amenities.
Demolish and reconstruct the Old Hampton Community Center. The
front entrance of the new facility will be oriented toward Armistead
Avenue and aligned with historic Grant Street. Upgrades will include
security cameras; efficient lighting and plumbing fixtures; and updated
communications and signage system.
